item.title: C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield physical edition launches this fall in the west
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch

Currently available digitally.

Aksys Games will release a physical edition of ACQUIRE-developed roguelike deckbuilder strategy RPG C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield for PlayStation 5 and Switch this fall in the west, the publisher announced.

C.A.R.D.S. RPG: The Misty Battlefield launched digitally for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 23, 2024 worldwide. A physical edition was released in Japan on the same date.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

An expanded version of the game that combines roguelike-style deckbuilding with strategy RPGs. Enjoy unique tactical gameplay that features over 100 varieties of cards with unique designs allowing players to build powerful decks and strategically confront enemies on an SRPG field. Every encounter requires a different strategy! Adapt to new battlegrounds and plan accordingly. Build the strongest deck and put a stop to the Hellmuth Brigade’s actions. The new “Mini-Game” mode lets players select a single unit and navigate a grid-based map, engaging in battles, upgrading, and making critical decisions. Your route and deck-building choices within limited turns will determine your success against the boss!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Q Collection announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Includes Q REMASTERED, Q with VTUBERS, and Q2 HUMANITY.

Publisher Aksys Games and developer liica have announced Q Collection for Switch. It includes puzzle games Q REMASTERED, Q with VTUBERS, and Q2 HUMANITY. It will launch in 2026.

Here is an overview of teh collection, via Aksys Games:

The Q puzzle series now makes its way to the Nintendo Switch as a collection of three games! With over 1,800 problems to solve, you’re bound to be entertained, whether you’d like to take on the challenges yourself or as a group. Q REMASTERED is a simple puzzle game in which players can freely draw lines and shapes on the screen. The drawn object will drop due to gravity. Q with VTUBERS features challenging and quirky puzzles designed by over 20 VTubers. The sequel Q2 HUMANITY introduces characters or “humans” that can jump, bounce, throw things, and sometimes even exhibit special abilities. Q2 can be played solo or with up to four players.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Path of Mystery: A Brush with Death coming west in spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Published by Aksys Games.

Aksys Games will release Path of Mystery: A Brush with Death, known as Mystery Walk in Japan, for Switch in the west in spring 2026, the publisher announced.

Path of Mystery: A Brush with Death first launched on December 14, 2024 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

Decades ago, a famous landscape artist was brutally murdered while painting late at night. At that time irregularities were found in the case and the primary suspect died in an apparent suicide. The case was closed and, over time, nearly forgotten. Thirty years later your university club, the Mystery Research Club, pries open old wounds, revisiting this unsolved case as a research assignment. Unexpected new clues are revealed as you use your secret ability to peer into the past, viewing key items and events in a new light. Use your uniquely gained knowledge to steer conversations and interviews with witnesses and potential suspects. Maintain your own secrets while uncovering a series of long-buried mysteries leading to the true killer.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Dungeon Stalkers adds PS5 version; launches in Early Access for PC on August 13
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

PlayStation 5 version currently in early stages of development.

Free-to-play player-versus-environment-versus-player dungeon crawler Dungeon Stalkers will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on August 13, developer ONEUNIVERSE announced. A PlayStation 5 version is also currently in the early stages of development.

It should be noted that while Dungeon Stalkers was previously developed by Studio HG, the “entire development studio” has moved to ONEUNIVERSE, and the game is still being worked on by “the exact same development team.”

Dungeon Stalkers was among the most-played demos at its Steam Next Fest debut in February 2024, and is currently sitting in a top 150 spot in the Steam wishlist charts following this past weekend’s final beta test.

Here is an overview of the game, via ONEUNIVERSE:

About

Dungeon Stalkers blends the exploration of classic dungeon crawling RPGs with the moment-to-moment intensity of extraction gameplay.

Choose your Stalker—each with their own story, personality, and skills—and descend into the Witch’s cursed dungeon. Enter solo or with trusted companions in teams of up to three. As you explore, gather loot, fight off corrupted monsters, and clash with rival Stalkers, your ultimate goal is to escape alive. But beware: no two runs are alike. The Witch’s Curse system dynamically alters dungeon conditions every session, changing the odds—and the challenges.

Key Features

  • Armor Destruction System – As characters take damage, this is represented visually with degraded armor and can be seen by enemy players, adding tension and strategic depth on how and when to engage.
  • Dynamic Witch’s Curse System – The Witch’s Curse changes dungeon conditions multiple times per session. Each 5 minute phase can bestow buffs, debuffs, summon power monsters or change rules on at moment’s notice
  • Multiple Game Modes – Choose between a lighter, fun and casual player-versus-environment experience or hardcore competitive player-versus-environment-versus-player dungeon run modes to suit your style and do so with teammates or solo.
  • Play as Unique Stalkers – Select from a roster of vivid, story-driven characters with diverse abilities and discover the story behind why each of them has found themselves here and unfold the secrets to the dungeon itself!
